page.title: 15The Vestry Estate
page.content: The estate was established to provide work and generate wealth following the decline of the railways, brickworks and agriculture after the Second World War. It is administered by a private company based in Sidcup and was part of a plan covering many similar parts of the country. The estate can be said to be successful in that it provides premises for over 40 industrial units, including Telecommunications, data processing, printing, motor factors, machine tool manufacturers, plastics and tile makers and storage and distribution depots, all of which provide for unskilled and skilled workers, both manual and white collar. Many users of the estate complain that they cannot attract skilled workers because of the high cost of housing. Others hope that the new M25 will solve some of the distribution problems encountered.
